page.name: Advantage
page.content:
Advantage

Home > Abilities > Advantage
Advantage Roll 2d20 and take the higher of the two rolls.
Disdvantage Roll 2d20 and take the lower of the two rolls.
  • A player cannot have double advantage or disadvantage. They do not stack.
  • A player with advantage & disadvantage gets neither. It is straight roll.
  • A feat or feature that allows a player to roll again, chooses which die.

Sources
Player’s Handbook, p. 173

page.name: Alternate Abilities
page.content:
Alternate Abilities

Home > Abilities > Alternate Abilities

Depending on the circumstances, a skill may be paired with a different ability score.
Animal Handling STR Attempting to subdue an animal with brute strength.
Athletics DEX An athletic feat, that requires agility more than strength.
Intimidation STR Using one’s physical presence instead of words to intimidate.
Performance DEX Playing an instrument or performing a intricate dance.
Sleight of Hand INT Doing something that requires a delicate hand and keen mind.
Stealth CHA Blending in at a party or on the street, instead of sneaking.

Sources
Player’s Handbook, p. XXX

page.name: Dexterity
page.content:
Dexterity

Home > Abilities > Dexterity

Balance, agility, and general nimbleness

Ability Checks

  • Pick a lock or disable a trap.
  • Tie up a prisoner with some rope.
  • Wriggle free after being tied up.
  • Craft a small or detailed object.

Initiative is a general dexterity check.

Attack & Damage Rolls

  • Ranged Attacks
  • Melee Attacks with Finesse Weapons

Skills & Other Abilities

Acrobatics Armor Class Hiding Sleight of Hand Stealth

Sources
Player’s Handbook, p. 176

Acrobatics

Home > Abilities > Dexterity > Acrobatics

Acrobatics measures the ability to maintain balance, tumble, and perform tricks in the air.

Skill Checks
Use skill checks for situations like:

  • Walk across a tightrope.
  • Maintain balance on a rocking ship.
  • Parkour down a cluttered alley.

Sources
Player’s Handbook, p. 176

Armor Class

Home > Abilities > Dexterity > Armor Class

A creature’s natural armor class is how hard they are to hit when not wearing armor.

Natural AC = 10 + Dexterity Modifier

Wearing armor replaces a creature’s natural AC with that of the armor they are wearing.

Sources
Player’s Handbook, p. 177

Hiding

Home > Abilities > Dexterity > Hiding

Hider (Stealth) v. Searcher (Perception)

  • DM decides when hiding is possible.
  • Cannot hide if clearly visible.
  • Cannot hide if searcher saw you hide.
  • Invisible creatures can always try.
  • Sound & tracks can give them away.
  • Ends if discovered or stop hiding.

Sources
Player’s Handbook, p. 177

Home > Conditions > Exhaustion
1 Disadvantage on ability checks

3 Disadvantage on attacks & saves
4 Hit point maximum halved

page.name: Petrified
page.content:
Petrified

Home > Conditions > Petrified

  • Transformed into a solid substance.
  • Mundane items are transformed too.
  • Weight increases by ten.
  • Frozen in time and stops aging.
  • Creature is incapacitated.
  • Can not move or speak.
  • Fail all STR & DEX saving throws.
  • Resistance to all damage types.
  • Immune to any new poison or disease.
  • Existing poison or disease suspended.
